nodes.name: Read CSV
nodes.description: It reads in CSV files and creates a DataFrame from it.
nodes.hint: Infer the schema when a new file is selected or the file content has changed

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: path
fields.title: Path
fields.description: Path of the file/directory

fields.name: separator
fields.title: Separator
fields.description: CSV Separator

fields.name: header
fields.title: Header
fields.description: Whether the file has a header row

fields.name: dropSpecialCharacterInColumnName
fields.title: Drop Special Character In ColumnName
fields.description: Whether to drop the Special Characters and Spaces in Column Name.

fields.name: mode
fields.title: Mode
fields.description: Mode for dealing with corrupt records during parsing.

fields.name: enforceSchema
fields.title: Enforce Schema
fields.description: If it is set to true, the specified or inferred schema will be forcibly applied to datasource files, and headers in CSV files will be ignored. If the option is set to false, the schema will be validated against all headers in CSV files in the case when the header option is set to true.

fields.name: addInputFileName
fields.title: Whether to Add Input File Name as Column in the Dataframe
fields.description: Add the new field:input_file_name

fields.name: encoding
fields.title: Encoding
fields.description: Decodes the CSV files by the given encoding type

fields.name: quote
fields.title: Quote
fields.description: Sets a single character used for escaping quoted values where the separator can be part of the value

fields.name: escape
fields.title: Escape
fields.description: Sets a single character used for escaping quotes inside an already quoted value.

fields.name: outputColNames
fields.title: Column Names for the CSV
fields.description: New Columns from CSV

fields.name: outputColTypes
fields.title: Column Types for the CSV
fields.description: Data Type of the Output Columns

fields.name: outputColFormats
fields.title: Column Formats for the CSV
fields.description: Format of the Output Columns

fields.name: extraOptionsKeys
fields.title: Properties Name
fields.description: Extra options/properites available while executing in Read CSV.

fields.name: extraOptionsValues
fields.title: Properties Value
fields.description: Config Values for the Corresponding properites name

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: title
fields.value: Customer Segments Wise Avg Monthly Revenue, No of Customers, Avg Income
fields.title: Title

fields.name: description
fields.value: This bar chart compares average monthly revenue, number of customers, and average income across different customer segments. It reveals a highly imbalanced distribution, with Customer Segment 0 having a significantly larger number of customers compared to all other segments, while other metrics are less pronounced.
fields.title: Description

fields.name: maxValuesToDisplay
fields.title: Max Values To Display
fields.description: Maximum number of values to display in result.

fields.name: isStreaming
fields.title: Is Streaming?
fields.description: Whether the Graph is a Streaming Graph or not

fields.name: xSortCol
fields.title: Sort on X Column?
fields.description: Whether to Sort on X column or not

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: groupingCols
fields.title: Grouping Columns
fields.description: Grouping Columns

fields.name: aggregateCols
fields.title: Aggregate Columns
fields.description: Aggregate Columns

fields.name: aggregateOperations
fields.title: Aggregate Operation
fields.description: Aggregate Operation

fields.name: outputColNames
fields.title: Output Column Names
fields.description: Output Column Names, default value is aggregateOperation_aggregateCol.

fields.name: whereClause
fields.title: Where Clause
fields.description: where condition before group by function

fields.name: havingClause
fields.title: Having Clause
fields.description: having condition after group by function

fields.name: title
fields.value: Box Plot on Months In Service for Each Segment
fields.title: Title

fields.name: description
fields.value: This box plot illustrates the distribution of Months In Service for each customer segment. It indicates that while most segments have a similar median tenure of around 15-20 months, Segment 0.0 shows a notably wider range of months in service, suggesting a more varied customer tenure within that specific group.
fields.title: Description

fields.name: maxValuesToDisplay
fields.title: Max Values To Display
fields.description: Maximum number of values to display in result.

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: title
fields.value: Box Plot on Monthly Revenue for Each Segment
fields.title: Title

fields.name: description
fields.value: This box plot illustrates the distribution of monthly revenue across different customer segments. It highlights that Segment 4.0 consistently generates significantly higher monthly revenue compared to other segments, while Segment 0.0 exhibits the lowest revenue range.
fields.title: Description

fields.name: maxValuesToDisplay
fields.title: Max Values To Display
fields.description: Maximum number of values to display in result.

fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: title
fields.value: Box Plot on Income Group for Each Segment
fields.title: Title

fields.name: description
fields.value: This box plot displays the distribution of income groups for each customer segment. It shows that most customer segments have a similar median income group, primarily falling within the middle range, with some segments exhibiting a wider spread of income groups.
fields.title: Description

fields.name: maxValuesToDisplay
fields.title: Max Values To Display
fields.description: Maximum number of values to display in result.

fields.name: title

fields.name: description

nodes.name: Cast To Single Type
nodes.description: This node creates a new DataFrame by casting the specified input columns to a new data type

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: inputCols
fields.title: Columns
fields.description: Columns to be cast to new data type

fields.name: outputColType
fields.title: New Data Type
fields.description: New data type for the selected columns (INTEGER, DOUBLE, STRING, LONG, SHORT)

fields.name: replaceExistingCols
fields.title: Replace Existing Cols?
fields.description: Whether to replace existing columns or create new ones?

nodes.name: Print N Rows
nodes.description: Prints the specified number of records in the DataFrame. It is useful for seeing intermediate output

fields.name: title
fields.value: Box Plot on Dropped Calls for Each Segment
fields.title: Title

fields.name: description
fields.value: This box plot shows the distribution of dropped calls across different customer segments. It highlights that Segment 4.0 experiences a significantly higher median number of dropped calls and a wider range compared to other segments, particularly Segment 0.0, which has very few dropped calls.
fields.title: Description

fields.name: maxValuesToDisplay
fields.title: Max Values To Display
fields.description: Maximum number of values to display in result.

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: title
fields.value: Box Plot on Overage Minutes for Each Segment
fields.title: Title

fields.name: description
fields.value: This box plot illustrates the distribution of overage minutes for each customer segment. It clearly shows that Segment 4.0 has a significantly higher median and a much wider range of overage minutes compared to other segments, indicating that customers in this segment frequently exceed their allocated minutes.
fields.title: Description

fields.name: maxValuesToDisplay
fields.title: Max Values To Display
fields.description: Maximum number of values to display in result.

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: title
fields.value: Box Plot on Received Calls for Each Segment
fields.title: Title

fields.name: description
fields.value: This box plot illustrates the distribution of received calls for each customer segment. It clearly shows that Segment 4.0 receives a significantly higher median number of calls and exhibits a much wider range compared to other segments, suggesting higher call activity within this group
fields.title: Description

fields.name: comment
fields.value:
Predicted Data Analysis on Test data: -

Customer Segments Wise Avg Monthly Revenue, Number of customers and Avg Income Group

Box Plot Help to Understand Min, Max, Median, First Quartile and Third Quartile for Each Segments on Numerical Features

  • Month In Service For Each Segments
  • Monthly Revenue For Each Segments
  • Income Group For Each Segments
  • Total Recurring Charge For Each Segments
  • Dropped Calls For Each Segments
  • Overage Minutes For Each Segments
  • Received Calls For Each Segments
